com.pb.sawdust.util.collections.cache

Class AbstractRefCache<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.collections.cache.AbstractRefCache<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - The type of the keys held by this cache.
    V - The type of the values held by this cache.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cache<K,V>, java.util.Map<K,V>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BoundedCache, DefinedCache

    public abstract class AbstractRefCache<K,V>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cache<K,V>
    The AbstractRefCache class provides a basic Cache implementation which orders its keys based on when they are referenced. This ordering can be used in a strategy to remove ("clean") key-value pairs. A key is considered to be "referenced" whenever it is used in a get, put, putAll, containsKey, or remove method (calls to non-existent keys (e.g. where containsKey(key) == false) are not used). The more recently a given key is referenced, the closer to the head of the deque it will be placed.

    Different levels of "cleaning priority" may be set, which define when the cache cleaning should take place. The default is to clean the cache whenever a valid key is referenced, however strategies also where cache cleaning never (automatically) occurs, where it occurs whenever the cache is modified, or where it occurs whenever a Cache interface method is called.

      The CacheCleaningPriority enum is used to define the frequency with which an AbstractRefCache is cleaned.

    • Method Detail

      • clipCache

        protected abstract K clipCache(SetDeque<K> keys)
        Clip a cache key from the cache map. This method is used to clean the cache: it is repeatedly called to determine what key-value pair should be removed from the cache. If no key should be removed, this method will return null. The cache key returned by this method will be removed from the cache (along with its corresponding value). This method takes the deque of keys as an input, and a cache key returned (for removal) should also have its corresponding key removed from the deque by this method.
        Parameters:
        keys - The deque of this cache's keys, ordered by key referencing.
        Returns:
        a cache key to be removed from the cache, or null if one should not be removed.

      • getCacheKeyDeque

        protected SetDeque<K> getCacheKeyDeque()
        Get the setdeque which will be used to hold (and order) the referenced keys in this cache. This setdeque should be empty and a reference to it should be unavailable to it outside of this method's scope.

        This method is used in the constructor, and should not be used elsewhere. This method should return a new empty instance of the backing setdeque type, not a reference to the setdeque used in this instance. That is, if this method is called repeatedly, a new object should be return, not a reference to one which has already been created. This requirement is to ensure data encapsulation in the Cache implementation.

        The default implementation returns a new LinkedSetList<K>.

        Returns:
        an empty setdeque.

      • getCacheMap

        protected java.util.Map<K,V> getCacheMap()
        Get the map which will be used to hold key-value mappings in this cache. This map should be empty and a reference ' to it should be unavailable to it outside of this method's scope. As the Map methods in this class generally will pass through to the map returned by this method, any benefits or disadvantages in the map implementation will be inheirited here too.

        This method is used in the constructor, and should not be used elsewhere. This method should return a new empty instance of the backing map type, not a reference to the map used in this instance. That is, if this method is called repeatedly, a new object should be return, not a reference to one which has already been created. This requirement is to ensure data encapsulation in the Cache implementation.

        The default implementation returns a new HashMap<K,V>.

        Returns:
        an empty map.

      • cleanCache

        public void cleanCache()
        "Clean" the cache by dropping key-value pairs from this cache deemed removable by the cache strategy. This method repeatedly calls clipCache(SetDeque), removing the returned cache key from the cache mapping, until null is returned.
        Specified by:
        cleanCache in interface Cache<K,V>
